entry.title: Combined summary - bitcoin-dev Mailing List Migration (Action Required)
entry.summary:
The bitcoindev mailing list has successfully transitioned to Google Groups, marking a significant change in its management and accessibility. This move came after some challenges were navigated, leading to the discontinuation of subscriptions via the old system from February 2024. To ensure continued access and participation, individuals are urged to subscribe to the new system without delay. A short grace period will precede the commencement of email exchanges on the new platform, allowing ample time for subscription.
Subscribing to the updated mailing list can be accomplished in two ways: sending an email to a specified address and replying to an automated confirmation message, or through a direct sign-up on the [Google Groups website](https://groups.google.com/g/bitcoindev). The latter method requires a Google account, which can be created with any email address. Subscribers are encouraged to opt-in for receiving all messages to facilitate active engagement and avoid potential disruptions in conversation threads. Additionally, implementing a filter for emails sent to the group's address is recommended for inbox organization.
The archive of the mailing list is readily accessible online without the need for a Google account and is supplemented by an external backup at [gnusha.org](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev), where historical content is also available. This approach underscores the non-critical use of Google's services, emphasizing their role in distributing information intended for public viewing. The community is encouraged to contribute by hosting additional public archives, with guidelines provided for setting up such resources. A comprehensive archive, including detailed instructions for verification, is available for download at [diyhpl.us](https://diyhpl.us/~bryan/irc/bitcoin/bitcoin-dev/bitcoin-dev-ml-archive.2024-02-09-004.tar.gz).
It is essential for participants to remember the nature of mailing lists as platforms for broad communication with limited moderation. Users are advised to consider the broader audience's interest when posting, especially when introducing new topics, to maintain the quality of discourse. The rules governing the mailing list have remained unchanged and can be reviewed on the Google Groups page. Special thanks were extended to Joe Rayhawk for his support during the migration process. For further inquiries or discussions related to the mailing list, moderator contact information is provided.
